> def validated_delete_table(table):

Need to add `self` as first parameter. ref: [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1647586/is-it-possible-to-change-an-instances-method-implementation-without-changing-al#comment89043742_1647616](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1647586/is-it-possible-to-change-an-instances-method-implementation-without-changing-al#comment89043742_1647616)

>         GenericUpdater().apply_patch(patch=gcu_patch, config_format=config_format, verbose=False, dry_run=False, ignore_non_yang_tables=False, ignore_paths=None)

Not an immediate ask, but we have plan to change the API, so apply patch will reuse the original `config_db_connector`. Currently its implementation create a temporary connector inside. #ByDesign

This pull request **introduces 1 alert** when merging fe323ffc9ed6d3c41852f7e07b596690768dc564 into bdc4a8a60c095a98709d115a6b6579e273993df8 - [view on LGTM.com](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/sonic-net/sonic-utilities/rev/pr-e3171c308424dddc0a98623c23cfd8ad4ef07db8)

**new alerts:**

* 1 for Wrong number of arguments in a call

Here is an example about use reflection:
http://www.sefidian.com/2021/06/06/python-__getattr__-and-__getattribute__-magic-methods/

```python
class ConfigDBConnector(object):
    def __init__(self, name):
        self.name = name
    def connect(self, name):
        print("ConfigDBConnector::connect")
    def gettable(self, table):
        print("ConfigDBConnector::gettable {} {}".format(table, self.name))
    def showtable(self, table):
        print("ConfigDBConnector::showtable {} {}".format(table, self.name))


# LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator can't be ConfigDBConnector
# because __getattr__ will check inherited method first
class LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator(object):
        def __init__(self, config_db_connector):
            self.connector = config_db_connector
        def deco_gettable(self, table):
            print("LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator::gettable {}".format(table))
            self.connector.gettable(table)
        def __getattr__(self, name):
            print("LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator __getattr__ {}".format(name))
            if name == "gettable":
                return self.deco_gettable
            originalMethod = self.connector.__getattribute__(name)
            return originalMethod

conn = ConfigDBConnector("123")
deco = LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator(conn)
deco.gettable("test")
deco.showtable("test")

```

Here is output:

>>> conn = ConfigDBConnector("123")
>>> deco = LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator(conn)
>>> deco.gettable("test")
LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator __getattr__ gettable
**LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator::gettable test** <<== "gettable" been decorated
ConfigDBConnector::gettable test 123
>>> deco.showtable("test")
LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator __getattr__ showtable
ConfigDBConnector::showtable test 123


The limit of this solution are:
1. The decorator class can't inherit ConfigDBConnector. if not follow this getattr will call itself and throw following error:

LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator __getattr__ showtable
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "<stdin>", line 11, in __getattribute__
  File "<stdin>", line 11, in __getattribute__
  File "<stdin>", line 11, in __getattribute__
  [Previous line repeated 992 more times]
  File "<stdin>", line 5, in __getattribute__
RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object

2. Performance impact: every API call need call __getattr__ first.

> Here is an example about use reflection: http://www.sefidian.com/2021/06/06/python-__getattr__-and-__getattribute__-magic-methods/
> 
> ```python
> class ConfigDBConnector(object):
>     def __init__(self, name):
>         self.name = name
>     def connect(self, name):
>         print("ConfigDBConnector::connect")
>     def gettable(self, table):
>         print("ConfigDBConnector::gettable {} {}".format(table, self.name))
>     def showtable(self, table):
>         print("ConfigDBConnector::showtable {} {}".format(table, self.name))
> 
> 
> # LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator can't be ConfigDBConnector
> # because __getattr__ will check inherited method first
> class LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator(object):
>         def __init__(self, config_db_connector):
>             self.connector = config_db_connector
>         def deco_gettable(self, table):
>             print("LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator::gettable {}".format(table))
>             self.connector.gettable(table)
>         def __getattr__(self, name):
>             print("LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator __getattr__ {}".format(name))
>             if name == "gettable":
>                 return self.deco_gettable
>             originalMethod = self.connector.__getattribute__(name)
>             return originalMethod
> 
> conn = ConfigDBConnector("123")
> deco = LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator(conn)
> deco.gettable("test")
> deco.showtable("test")
> ```
> 
> Here is output:
> 
> > > > conn = ConfigDBConnector("123")
> > > > deco = LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator(conn)
> > > > deco.gettable("test")
> > > > LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator **getattr** gettable
> > > > **LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator::gettable test** <<== "gettable" been decorated
> > > > ConfigDBConnector::gettable test 123
> > > > deco.showtable("test")
> > > > LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator **getattr** showtable
> > > > ConfigDBConnector::showtable test 123
> 
> The limit of this solution are:
> 
> 1. The decorator class can't inherit ConfigDBConnector. if not follow this getattr will call itself and throw following error:
> 
> LayeredConfigDBConnectorDecorator **getattr** showtable Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "", line 11, in **getattribute** File "", line 11, in **getattribute** File "", line 11, in **getattribute** [Previous line repeated 992 more times] File "", line 5, in **getattribute** RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object
> 
> 2. Performance impact: every API call need call **getattr** first.

Thank you @liuh-80 ! I refactored the decorator based on your input
/easycla

Hi @mlorrillere, the unit tests added for the fabric counter, `tests/fabricstat_test.py`,  are failing.
I think the reason they are failing is because the tests are trying to connect to the actual redis instance iso for mock db.
the script `fabricstat` the mock db must if the `UTILITIES_UNIT_TESTING` enivornment variable is set.

Please refer to this block as an example https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/blob/master/scripts/intfutil#L15-L28

Hi @arlakshm 

I've addressed the remaining issues and all checks passed.
